Package robot

Defines a set of classes for manipulating the "Robot Virtual Machine" (RVM).

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Analysis
    Assembly functions - class Analysis
    Provides the funcions for checking terrains and neighborhoods content.
    Arit
    Assembly functions - class Arit
    Provides the funcions for arithmetic operations (sum, subtraction, multiplication, division and modulus) in the data inside the stack of the virtual machine.
    Command
    Commands
    Generates a triple [ function, argument, label ] from strings for being used to process a robot's program.
    Ctrl
    Ctrl
    Given a assembly function name and its argument (if required), executes it for the Virtual Machine specified.
    Func
    Assembly functions - class Func
    Provides the funcions for controlling the creation of functions: CALL and RET (special types of jumps).
    IO
    Assembly functions - class IO
    Provides the funcions for checking the data inside the stack of the virtual machine.
    Jumps
    Assembly functions - class Jumps
    Provides the funcions for conditional (JMP) and unconditional (JIF/JIT) jumps in the Program Counter (PC) of a giver Virtual Machine.
    Mem
    Assembly functions - class Mem
    Provides the funcions for using the auxiliar memory in the virtual machine.
    Prog
    Assembly functions - class Prog
    Provides the funcions for controlling the program: no operation (NOP) and end of program (END).
    RVM
    Main package class with the constructor of the robot and its data.
    Stk
    Assembly functions - class Stk
    Provides the funcions for manipulating the main stack of the virtual machine.
    Syst
    Assembly functions - class Syst
    Implements the commands MOVE, DRAG, DROP, HIT, LOOK and get from the World if it has permission for executing the correspondent action.
    Tests
    Assembly functions - class Tests
    Provides the funcions for making boolean comparisons between elements inside the stack of the virtual Machine

Package robot Description

Defines a set of classes for manipulating the "Robot Virtual Machine" (RVM).

The main class RVM can be instanced for generating an assembly-machine. This simple assembly provides many functions that allow the robot to interact with its environment.

The assembly function are:

  • ADD
  • CALL
  • DIV
  • DRAG
  • DROP
  • DUP
  • END
  • EQ
  • GE
  • GT
  • HIT
  • ITEM
  • JIF
  • JIT
  • JMP
  • LE
  • LOOK
  • LT
  • MOD
  • MOVE
  • MUL
  • NE
  • NOP
  • POP
  • PRN
  • PUSH
  • RCL
  • RET
  • SEE
  • SEEK
  • STO
  • SUB
